titleStmt.title:
A Description of a
City Shower.

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: Careful Observers may fortell ye Hour
By sure Prognosticks when to dread a Show'r.
While Rain depends, ye pensive Cat gives o'er
Her Frolicks & pursues her Tail no more.
Returning home at Night you'll find ye Sink
Strike your offended Sense wth double Stink.
If you be wise, then go not far to dine,
You'll spend in Coach hire more than save in wine
A coming Show'r your shooting corns presage,
Old Aches throb, your hollow tooth will rage.
Saunt'ring in Coffee house is Dulman seen:
He damns ye Climate & complains of Spleen.
Mean while ye South, rising wth dabbled wings
A sable Cloud athwart ye Welkin flings,
That swill'd more liquor than it could contain,
And like a Drunkard gives it up again.
Brisk Susan whips her Linnen from ye Rope,
While ye first drizzling Show'r is born aslope
Such is that sprinkling wch some careless Quean
Flirts on you from her Mop, but not so clean.
You fly, invoke ye Gods, then turning, stop
To rail; she singing still whirls on her Mop.
Not yet ye Dust had shun'd th'unequal strife
But aided by ye Wind, fought still for Life,
And wafted wth its Foe by violent Gust,
'Twas doubtful wch was Rain, & which was Dust.
Ah! where must needy Poet seek for Aid,
When Dust & Rain at once his Coat invade?
His only Coat, where Dust confus'd wth Rain
Roughen ye Nap, & leave a mingled Stain.
Now in contiguous drops ye flood comes down\gutter\
Threat'ning wth Deluge this devoted Town;
To Shops in Crowds ye daggled Females fly,
Pretend to cheapen Goods, but nothing buy:
The Templar spruce, while ev'ry spout's abroach\cropped\
Stays till 'tis fair, yet seems to call a Coach:
The tuck'd up Sempstress walks wth hasty strides,
While streams run down her oild Umbrella's sides.
Here various kinds by various Fortunes led,
Commence Acquaintance underneath a Shed,
Triumphant Tories, & desponding Whigs,
Forget their Feuds, & join to save their Wigs:
Box'd in a Chair ye Beau impatient sits,
While spouts run clatt'ring o'er ye roof by Fits:
And ever & anon, wth frightful Din
The Leather sounds; he trembles from within.
So when Troy Chair-men bore ye wooden Steed,
Pregnant wth Greeks, impatient to be freed;
Those Bully Greeks, who, as ye Moderns do,
Instead of paying Chair men, run them thro.
Laocoon struck ye Outside wth his Spear,
And each imprison'd Hero quak'd for Fear.
Now from all parts ye swelling Kennels flow,
And bear their Trophies wth them as they go:
Filths of all Hues & Odours, seem to tell
What Street they sail'd from, by their sight & smell.
They, as each Torrent drives, wth rapid Force
From Smithfield, or St Pulcre's, shape their course\gutter\
And in huge Confluent join at Snowhill ridge,
Fall from ye Conduit prone to Holbourn bridge.
Sweepings from Butchers stalls, dungs, guts, & blood, 3}
Drown'd Puppies, stinking Sprats, all drench'd in mud
Dead Cats, & Turnip tops, come tumbling down ye flood.
